name: GuidanceResponse
title: GuidanceResponse
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Clinical Decision Support)
description: A guidance response is the formal response to a guidance request, including any output parameters returned by the evaluation, as well as the description of any proposed actions to be taken.

elements.name: GuidanceResponse
elements.description: A guidance response is the formal response to a guidance request.

elements.name: requestIdentifier
elements.description: The identifier of the request associated with this response. If an identifier was given as part of the request, it will be reproduced here to enable the requester to more easily identify the response in a multi-request scenario.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: Allows a service to provide  unique, business identifiers for the response.

elements.name: moduleUri
elements.description: An identifier, CodeableConcept or canonical reference to the guidance that was requested.

elements.name: moduleCanonical
elements.description: An identifier, CodeableConcept or canonical reference to the guidance that was requested.

elements.name: moduleCodeableConcept
elements.description: An identifier, CodeableConcept or canonical reference to the guidance that was requested.

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of the response. If the evaluation is completed successfully, the status will indicate success. However, in order to complete the evaluation, the engine may require more information. In this case, the status will be data-required, and the response will contain a description of the additional required information. If the evaluation completed successfully, but the engine determines that a potentially more accurate response could be provided if more data was available, the status will be data-requested, and the response will contain a description of the additional requested information.

elements.name: subject
elements.description: The patient for which the request was processed.

elements.name: encounter
elements.description: The encounter during which this response was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.

elements.name: occurrenceDateTime
elements.description: Indicates when the guidance response was processed.

elements.name: performer
elements.description: Provides a reference to the device that performed the guidance.

elements.name: reasonCode
elements.description: Describes the reason for the guidance response in coded or textual form.

elements.name: reasonReference
elements.description: Indicates the reason the request was initiated. This is typically provided as a parameter to the evaluation and echoed by the service, although for some use cases, such as subscription- or event-based scenarios, it may provide an indication of the cause for the response.

elements.name: note
elements.description: Provides a mechanism to communicate additional information about the response.

elements.name: evaluationMessage
elements.description: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts. As part of evaluating the request, the engine may produce informational or warning messages. These messages will be provided by this element.

elements.name: outputParameters
elements.description: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any. Many modules will result in the return of specific resources such as procedure or communication requests that are returned as part of the operation result. However, modules may define specific outputs that would be returned as the result of the evaluation, and these would be returned in this element.

elements.name: result
elements.description: The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

elements.name: dataRequirement
elements.description: If the evaluation could not be completed due to lack of information, or if a potentially more accurate response could be provided if more data was available, this element will a description of the data required in order to proceed with the evaluation. A subsequent request to the service should include this data.
